Product Name: Nike Strike Soccer Ball (White/Racer Blue) (5)
Author: David
Body: I've been using this ball for about 2 months now. I highly recommend this ball. It can withstand being shot and having firm driven passes to a brick wall. Body: Love these soccer shorts, definitely my favorite. Have them in black and white now. I like to usually roll the top once but that's just personal preference. I feel like Complaints I've seen on these come from people not realizing they're for soccer! So of course they aren't long like basketball shorts and they're also without pockets which is all standard for soccer. These would be great for running too if you don't need pockets.

Product Name: Nike Men's Team Equalizer Soccer Shorts, Black, Medium
Author: Jennifer Miller
Body: Product as described. Light weight, thin, breathable material. Comfortable with no restriction of movement. I'm 5'-9" 175lbs. I ordered XL's which fall just at mid height of my knee cap. I'm sure a L would fit as well with a more traditional length.

Product Name: Nike Men's Team Equalizer Soccer Shorts, Black, Medium

I contacted Amazon to make them aware of my concern and have asked them to investigate. Happy to update when they complete their research.

Product Name: adidas Youth Entrada 18 Jersey, White/Black, Medium
Author: Bel C
Body: My ten-year-old brother is EXTREMELY picky about what he wears. For a short, scrawny boy with braces, he sure cares a lot about his clothes. If a shirt is too itchy: he won't wear it. If a shirt is too long: he won't wear it. If a shirt just doesn't give him the right vibe: he won't wear it! His fussiness caused him to wear the same shirt everyday for about two years. He had about 12 of the exact same shirt that he would rotate through, to the disdain of all of the women in his life. However, when he started to realize that his limited closet wasn't attracting the ladies, he accepted that it was time for him to branch out. After a few failed attempts, we found these puppies! My brother is a very avid soccer player, and Adidas is his favorite brand of all time (it is a million times better than Nike in his opinion), so these were an instant success. He now has these shirts in all different colors, and I haven't heard a single complaint about them. I would highly recommend this shirt for the hard to shop for boys in your life. Never again will my brother have to hear comments from friends and family about how he's wearing the same shirt in every picture! He loves these shirts. I should know, I am his big sister after all.

Product Name: adidas Men's Copa Gloro 19.2 Firm Ground, Black/Black/Solar Yellow, 8.5 M US
Author: Bryan R.
Body: These things look awesome. I try to never spend more than $50 on cleats and these were slightly above my usual budget, but just barely, at $65. That being said, I do not buy the top model in any cleat, because I believe at a certain point you're throwing money away for a few more features that may or may not add to the quality of your game. For the cleats, they have a retro look with the tongue covering the laces, and a nice leathery surface to strike and control the ball. I bought a half size up than I normally do, and need to tie them tight for a firm lock-down on my foot. One of the downsides to such a tight fit is how it puts a little bit of pressure on the outside of the foot, but with time it will loosen up due to the leather. I use these on bad astro-turf (basically rubber pellets on a green carpet) and firm ground, and they have held up fine. One of the reasons I decided to buy the Adidas brand is their 2 year warranty which covers events like soles splitting at the seams, which is a usual occurrence with soccer cleats. To be fair, I've never actually done the process of submitting a claim, but if I do I will update this review. Solid boots for wider feet with minimal discomfort, good touch, and retro design.

Product Name: adidas Men's Copa Gloro 19.2 Firm Ground, Black/Black/Solar Yellow, 8.5 M US
Author: The Duke Daniel
Body: They were good for like 5 runs, cleets didn't even last a couple months. Bought in early April and the side of the shoes finally split open as well as the soles. Look else where for cleats. I'm 5,10 220lbs and play CDM. I can't give a 1 star because I actually do like the cleets but material and build quality isn't there. But of coarse it looks like I'm in the minority here.

Product Name: adidas Men's Copa Gloro 19.2 Firm Ground, Black/Black/Solar Yellow, 8.5 M US
Author: Bryan R.
Body: Wow, nice leather, seemed to wear in on the first practice. Definitely worth the money but if your feet have stopped growing and you are going to play a lot for a few bucks more (retail) look into the Kangaroo leather which are like wearing a good strong sock or the regular leather with replaceable spikes. That's how nice these are. My feet are wide around the ball of the foot. I wear a 10 in Asics running shoes and wore a 10 in these. The yellow part of the ankle section of this shoe seems to be a synthetic part, soft and forming. I have had them for 4 months now and still look practically new.

Product Name: adidas Men's Copa Gloro 19.2 Firm Ground, Black/Black/Solar Yellow, 8.5 M US
Author: The Duke Daniel
Body: The shoe looks beautiful.  The laces don't go high enough on my foot, so there is a half inch gap where the tongue meets the lace eyelets.  The forefoot leather feels loose and comfortable.  I often find myself tightening and relacing after 10 minutes of running about.also, I got blisters from the stiff liner material running along the back of my ankle.  I've developed callous on my heels now, but I suffered quite a lot of pain to get to this point.  Will definitely not buy again.

Product Name: adidas Men's Copa Gloro 19.2 Firm Ground, Black/Black/Solar Yellow, 8.5 M US

Body: I have a wider foot and the leather has just enough give to fit my foot and still be tight enough for ball control. Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Bridget
Body: Great shinguards, girls say they're very comfortable once on. Shinguards are a bit difficult to get over the heels. I got 2 sets of these S/M sized shinguards for my twins. 3 of the shinguards slide on pretty easily and 1 is soo hard to get on over the heel. Once the girls are wearing them, they say they are super comfortable and they feel like they're not wearing anything at all. My girls are nearly 9 years old and about 51 inches. One twin is 60lbs and the other is about 63lbs. I don't know if I'd size up or not, they are very sensitive to things rubbing on them and these definitely don't move around on them. The girls love them, I just wish they were a little easier to slide on.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Kindle Customer
Body: I recommend these to all the parents of boys on my son's team. These are great, my son truly enjoys wearing them, they stay in place, he's VERY aggressive and he never complains or shows signs of injury or bruising, and I can clean them. He plays premier soccer, and he is in these year round and for significant amounts of time, he said they are much more comfortable. In fact he doesn't take them off unless I remind him.As a parent I wish they had ankle protection, but he says it's better without ankle protection because it lets him move his ankle and foot better and it's not interfering with his shoes (his feedback, my words). I asked his coach about the ankle pads who said it is not a big deal and that it can help kids with ball control and agility. So I knock of half a star although my son and his coach disagree.They are also a little hard to get off but if you scrunch them a little and then pull from the bottom they slip off ok. That just means I have to help him, which is minor. So I knock of half a star.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Bridget
Body: Purchased a pair of these for my 8 year old for the fall soccer season. They seem to run on the small side so take that into consideration. The shin guards are light and easy to put on. They are not always easy to remove. There is a small price to pay for something so low profile. Overall these have been fantastic and I ended up buying another pair for one of the other soccer players in our family.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Jennifer Jackson
Body: So far so good!  I got these for my son (8 years old) and he really likes them! He's said that they are really comfortable and they don't slide around as much as his Nike shin guards.Since his calves are skinnier, he slips the sleeves from his other shin guards over the gforms for added security.  The only minor complaint he's made is that it is harder to take off.  Other than that, it's been great for him!Joe

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: michaelsean
Body: My son (U-10) loves the new shin guards. He always fought the kind that had an ankle guard and the shin guards that just slip into socks tend to move around and bug him. He loves these and he even leaves them on after practice sometimes for hours because he says he forgets he even has them on. He has been kicked a couple times and they are as effective as other shin guards in that regard. They do require some help to pull off though but its not hard for me to pull them off (he just can't get it over his foot by himself).

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: JA
Body: My son doesn't like using shinguards, period. So this ones are a good choice because they are not bulky as the traditional kind. However, they are very hard to take off, more so than to put them on. Especially if you are sweaty or wet. So this part is really frustrating to my son.We both think that they are not really protective either. So is you are playing a really rough game, this may not be your best choice. Since my son is U10, the kids are still restrained from hitting others, so its still ok. But when he outgrow them we may have to go back to the bulky ugly traditional ones for the sake of protection.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Kevin Davis
Body: Wow, these are so great - I wish that I would have found out about these two years ago. So much more comfortable for my kid than wearing other types of soccer shin guards. They protect quite well, they stay on securely, they are easy to put on, and it's great to be able to throw them into the washing machine along with uniform after the game/practice.I am going to get another pair as a backup.Putting four stars instead of five for two reasons:1. After a game / practice, these are not easy to take off. I have to help my kid do it. Otherwise, I feel like he'd damage them in the process of taking them off.2. The upper elastic bands of these shin guards tend to dig into the skin more than I would expect

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Tatiana Lewis
Body: Much better than I expected. Bought these for my 9 yr old son who plays on an academy travel team. Was tired of fighting with him on putting the regular type of shin guards on. We’ve used these for almost a whole season so far. Quality seems great. Much better than the traditional ones that have the loops for your feet. They don’t slide at all. Definitely would buy again if they broke or were lost.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: DL
Body: Tiny. Wish I could return. Purchased 1 month ago to the date and return not an option. They are a great concept. My son is 8 and the S/M looks like it could fit a 4 or 5 year old.

Author: Mikegezz
Body: Maybe I had greater expectations than was delivered. Bought for my daughter and when she tried them on she said they were very comfortable but the shin guard did not protect well from the impact. I did not believe her so I tried them for myself and the impact protection left much to be desired.  However Amazon's return Policy is Amazing so we had no issues returning the shin guards

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Bridget
Body: These aren't what I expected... they're almost like what you'd find in a kid's Halloween costume set.  I used the size chart and read the reviews... purchased my 10 year old son a  Youth S/M and they are so small he can't even get them over his foot.  He tried to use them as forearm guards... but his hands started to go numb, so I guess the next step is to give them to a smaller child.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Kindle Customer
Body: My 8 year old  son has been wearing these 4-5 days a week for training and games and loves them. They're holding up very well. No signs of wear after heavy use and washing. The only drawback is they're difficult to take off of a sweaty leg. I guess this could also be seen as a positive since they don't move around and shift during play. I'm very impressed with the product so far.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Magnum
Body: These are a bit of a pain to get on and off because they are quite tight fitting.  But my son likes them as an alternative to some basic shin pads that were always slipping down his socks.  Not sure how protective they are but they are light and breathable and a good price.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: J. Button
Body: Delivered on time and intact. Product is what is described. Very easy to get on and stays on. I took off 2 stars because OMG I CANT GET THE DARN THINGS OFF!  The only way I can get these off of my 8 yo is to wait until he cools down COMPLETELY. If your child is the littlest tiniest bit sweaty then forget it. Not thrilled but not disappointed. It has actually added a little comedy to our lives...for now.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: anthonyg
Body: So far, so good.  I bought the L/XL youth size for my 8 year old and they fit with some room to grow.  They are flexible and lightweight as described and like others mentioned they can be a bit challenging to get off but just take a little effort to get the technique down.  We used the hard plastic style shin guards with the built in ankle protection in the past which took similar effort to remove.  Overall my son seems to really like these and seem to provide good protection and allows excellent movement.  Great purchase!

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: michelle s
Body: My 11 yr old son plays competitive soccer & really loves these shin guards.  They don't move around while he's in play & they protect him.  Being washable makes it VERY good!! The only complaint he has is the struggle to take them off after play.  I guess the sweat makes them hard to come off but overall VERY happy with this purchase & will definitely buy another pair when needed.

Author: Ellice  Wirthlin
Body: My son is 12 and wears a size 6 shoe, he is in a L/XL youth shinguard.  She does have a thinner calf.  This is his 2nd pair as his 1st pair was the youth smaller size.Why we prefer these?1.  Guaranteed shinguards will stay in place throughout an intense game (a big pet peeve of mine seening players adjusting shinguards in the game.  such a distraction.)2.  Only 2 pieces.  Less to lose. (unlike the sleeve and loose shinguard style, which is 4 individual pieces)These can be a little tough to get on and off over the heel, but you will know the right fit if once on the calf it fits smoothly without indenting the calf.My son does use the slip in shinguard for practice just for ease of putting on.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Bridget
Body: The G-Form Youth Compact Shinguards are soft and flexible as described on the product page. Several of our grandchildren are very active in  outdoor sports and one of the twelve year old agreed to try them out for me. She plays soccer on a school team and is always interested in new equipment. She states that the shinguard are very comfortable and when she was running around playing soccer she didn't feel the guards on at all. They did not rub on her legs as has happened with other brand guards. Also she was kicked in the shin (accidentally. of course) and did not feel the kick at all with these shinguard on. She also said that  these offer good protection and didn't move or change position while on her leg which meant she didn't have to stop and readjust them during the game.The one concern she had was that they felt a little tight on. Hers were a youth  S/M size . She thought possibly she should try a bigger size. These are fine at the moment but we will keep checking the tightness.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Kindle Customer
Body: Needed new shin guards for my daughter to play summer/fall soccer.  They are nice, much more comfortable to wear than other guards we've used in the past.  Way less complaining when she wears them.  One thing I did notice, check the size needed before buying, they seem to run a bit small, at least for my daughter anyways.  Being that it's 8 and 9yr old's, there's a ton of missed kicks on the soccer ball and plenty of good shin kicks instead.  So far they seem to have been able to absorb even the hardest of punts without leaving any bruises or cry's of pain.  It's really cool how they are actually very soft and squishy - until impact, at which point they stiffen up to protect the shin.  Makes them much easier to keep on for the longer practices.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Editor of Lillian's Diaries
Body: My kid wears these, and his evaluation is 'fine yeah', so i'll paste in my review of the adult-size equivalent:--These are... kinda awesome. I like having a little compression on my calves when being active, and i freakin' hate when the velcro on classic shin guards comes loose and stabs me, or when inserts wander off to some other part of my leg. It's also neat that you don't need to take your socks into consideration, either for holding the guard on your shin (with inserts) or the extra bulk under foot (for stirrup-style guards).The down side? They're a little sweatier than stirrup-style guards, especially under match socks.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: ATechnoholic
Body: My daughters love these for soccer and mountain biking.  Super comfy they wear them and never complain.  1 Star off for the stitching, as many posters have commented, which breaks and unravels easily.  But I’m here to tell you the cure... while you’re here buy some Fray Lock which is sewing thread “glue” for a couple bucks.  Run it over the stitching and it won’t break, or after it does use this to fix/stop unraveling.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Silea
Body: These fit my grandson well and have been very durable and effective.He needs his parents help to pull them on, but once on the fit well and are fairly comfortable, and he plays sports in the hot humid deep south.I do feel they are a wee bit pricy for what you get.  Costs add up fast for young kiddos sports as they outgrow everything so quickly

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: peffer
Body: Kids loved these. My son put these on when we first received them and didn't take them off for hours. He thought they were super cool. I like the flexibility but do wonder how protective it actually is compared to solid plastic guards. Simply put, they protect well, but not as well as traditional shin guards that have a sold plastic shield. The good news, is that if you want shin protection without a bulky traditional shin guard, then these are perfect. I can see this as a great grappling shin guard or a great judo shin guard ...

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Living it up
Body: These Youth Small size shinguards are tiny and for younger and smaller kids probably from 4-7 years of age.They are high quality and well made. The stretch fabric is supportive and soft while the foam padding is compressive yet durable.They are tight fitting. They won't fit for larger legs.The padding is very protective. It absorbs a good impact and disperses it well. The design of the guards while protective do allow for a good range of movement.They air dry relatively fast and clean up well with a little soap and water.5 stars.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Amazon Customer
Body: These are very interesting shin guards, not the hard plastic strap on kind that go under the socks, but a flexible sleeve with the padding sewn on that goes over the socks.  Do not attempt to put these on without socks on first, because they don't go on easy and are hard to get off.  We made that mistake initially.The plastic padding feels just like a wrestling mat, same give and same feel.  These are definitely more comfortable, and definitely more flexible.  Seems like a good amount of padding.  I really like the "sleeve" concept to these.They will fit average sized kids, these are the small/mediums so they will fit kids 3'5" to 4'1" tall.  If you have a very husky child the sleeve might not fit as comfortably around the shin, but skinny to average sizes will have no problem.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Earth Spirits
Body: A great choice for first years of soccer. They fit my 4 year old well and he seemed quite comfortable. They look cool, too. And yes they are protective. At that age there aren't really serious impacts so I couldn't say just how much these can take, but they are definitely sufficient for children's soccer. And my kid feels like Iron Man wearing them.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: JKT
Body: I sure wish I was a kid in this day and age. Growing up, I had to use the wicked uncomfortable plastic shin guards - rigid strips of plastic that slid into little sleeves. They were awful to wear.These things are incredible. They are soft and flexible and my son has no complaints when wearing them. Despite being so soft, they provide a ton of cushiony protection.Simply put, the future is here and it is comfortable.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Bridget
Body: I like how lightweight and comfortable these are.  She is willing to put them on before practice without any difficulty.  It used to be that they were one of the last things that went on and never before we got to practice.  As i have mentioned before, some shin guards are the equivalent of tying a rock around your shin.I also like that these are machine washable.  That makes a big difference for me.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Kindle Customer
Body: These shin guards are all one piece unlike the old traditional ones where the sleeve and guards are two separate pieces. The guards are sewn into the sleeve and it is soft and flexible, but hardens on impact. The flexible guard is more comfortable to wear and feels like wearing no guard at all. It is less distracting during play since it stays in place with no tape or additional sleeve required. These give players better mobility due to their low profile, giving improved knee and ankle movement. Shin guards should be worn facing forward. Because they are made directly into the sleeve they can be more difficult to remove than traditional guards.  These can be machine washed and lined dry. This keeps the bacteria down and the guards fresh and clean for each use. They meet the National Operating Committee on Standards for Athletic Equipment (NOCSAE) standard and they are made in the USA. These are definitely winners for me.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Trouble
Body: My daughter reports that these are the most comfortable shin guards she's ever worn. She loves the feel of them because they're nicely padded and soft. However, they seem to run fairly small. The S/M is really a bit too small for her (she's 11) and will soon need to be passed down to a smaller player. I should have gotten the larger size.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: G. Hearn
Body: I love that there aren't any velcro pieces and they are flexible! My daughter's current shinguards require them to go over her feet and velcro in 2 spots and I think sometimes she walks a little stiff. These are so nice to slip on and slip off, we fight with her current ones to get her socks on and off and as well as her shoes!

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: Kat Hooper
Body: Some of the best shin guards we have used.  My boys really like the ease of use of these.  They also like the way they feel when playing.  The protect your shins but they flex and and allow better movement.  Easy to pull on and off.  Also washable to help get rid of the funk.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: KO
Body: I like these shin guards because they will stay in place and provide adequate padding without being bulky.  They are quite small.  I thought the medium size would fit my 10 year old, but he could not even get them over his foot.  I would go with an adult medium for him most likely.  As a soccer player, I think these provide all of the protection needed; however, they do provide less protection than other styles that cover more of the shin and even the ankles. These are rubbery rather than a hard shell.  I think it is important to have the right size so that the sleeve is neither too tight or too loose.

Product Name: G-Form Youth PRO-S Compact Shinguard-Blk-L/XL
Author: James A. Nichols
Body: I got this for my son. I like that it is pull up rather than Velcro or just put in place. I also like that it is flexible. I'm surprised by how small it is, but for practice in the yard this will work. For games, though, I'll be going back to full size guards.

Author: Amazon Customer
Body: I bought the size medium for my 4'10" 11 year old. His calf circumference is about normal for a kid his age and size. We definitely know kids with skinnier calves though. The sleeves meant to hold the shin guards are too loose to stay up/stay in place, even when over socks. The shin guards themselves are about the right size for him though. He's right in the middle of the range for a medium. I liked the idea he could just slip them into his socks if he has long enough socks or use the sleeve if his socks are too short. I'm going to return for a small  but its possible we will just need to find another brand. It would be helpful if the size range included a calf size measurement.
